result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex N. Hitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alex N. Hitz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alex N. Hitz was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Alex N. Hitz was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Alex N. Hitz in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 10:20 am.  State gives plea agreement, ct's 3 & 8, ct's 9 & 10 dismiss with prejudice & Deferred Entry of Judgment, State request to move to strike provision with K.H. Court questions why this kind of plea agreement.  State gives reason.  Atty Casey gives statement. State gives def. criminal history. Court reviews CCAP history. Atty Casey gives statement.  Court will proceed.  Plea questionnaire & waiver rights filed. Def. understands charges and penalties. Ct 3 Possess Drg Parap, Guilty, Ct 8 Bail jumping, Guilty, Dismissed with prejudice ct's 9 & 10.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements. Def. agrees with agreement & conditions. Atty Casey is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given, Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts pleas & finds def. Guilty to ct 3 & ct 8 and will approve however gives statement before approves & now approves & directs clerk not to enter conviction
Ct's 1 2 4 5 6 & 7 court found no probable cause,  bound over 3 8 9 & 10. Clarifies that were dismiss on p.h. date because didn't bind over. Court orders bond of $5,000.00  with no possession of controlled substance w/out valid prescription and will remove no contact provision with K.H. No new bond needed.  Review hearing scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Alex N. Hitz in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:59 p.m. Lt. Daniel Bauknecht duly sworn on oath, testifies. State asks Court to take judicial notice of 14CM248, 15CM28, 15CM160 and 12CM171. Court does so for purpose stated. State moves bind over. Atty Casey moves to dismiss felony cts. Arguments by Counsel. Remarks by the Court, binds over on ct 1. Court now decides to bind over on misd. cts only. Does not bind over on cts 1 & 2. Finds probable cause on ct 3. Does not bind over on cts 4, 5, 6 or 7. Bind over on cts 8, 9, and 10. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
No contact with K. H. No possession of controlled substance w/out valid prescription.

Defendant Alex N. Hitz in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Defendant Alex N. Hitz in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM160, 15CM28, 14CM248, 14CT79 @ 1:49 p.m. Agreement 14CT79 - plea to ct 1 , ct 2 dismiss BAC .103, 5 days jail w/ credit for 1 day served, $1379.00, 12 months revocation, 1 yr IID. Then 14CM248 will amend ct 2 to OWI 3rd, BAC .107, ct 3 dismiss, plea to ct 1 & 2, ct 2 - 45 days jail w/credit for 1 day served, consecutive to 14CT79, $1694, 24 month revoke, 24 months IID, AODA, Ct 1 - 60 days jail, consecutive to 14CT79 and to ct 2 of 14CM248. 15CM28 - all cts dismissed and read in. 15CM160 plea to ct 1 and ct 2, ct 3 & 4 dismiss and read in. 120 days jail on both cts, no credit for time served, consecutive to 14CT79 and consecutive to ct 2 in14CM248, but concurrent with each other and concurrent to 60 days in 14CM248, court costs, DNA sample and surcharges. Question by the Court regarding jail time. Atty Casey agrees with stated agreement. Def understands and agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. 15CM160 plea to ct 1 guilty. Ct 2 guilty plea. 14CT79 ct 1 guilty plea. 14CM248 ct 1 -guilty plea. Court grants motion to amend ct 2 to OWI 3rd. Guilty plea. 15CM160 cts 3 & 4 dismiss and read in. 14CT79 ct 2 dismissed and consolidated. 14CM248 ct 3 dismiss and consolidated. 15CM28 all cts dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Casey satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CM160 ct 1 OAR and ct 2 misd bail jumping. 14CT79 ct 1 OWI 2nd, and 14CM248 ct 1 misd bail jumping and ct 2 OWI 3rd. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Nothing by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Orders 14CT79 ct 1 5 days jail, credit for 1 day served, fine and costs 1379.00. 12 months revocation, IID 1 yr, effective upon application. 14CM248 ct 2 - 45 days jail w/credit for 1 day, consecutive to 14CT79,  $1694 fine and costs, 24 months revoke, IID 2 yrs, AODA and follow through. Ct 1 - 60 days jail, consecutive to 14CT79 and to ct 2, court costs . 15CM160 ct 1 - 60 days jail, consecutive to all others ordered today, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Ct 2 - 60 days jail, concurrent to ct 1 in this case, consecutive to all others ordered today, costs inc. DNA surcharge. No credit for time served. Huber. Bonds in 15CM160 and 15CM28 apply to fines and costs. Pmt plan for balance. Postconviction rights. Pmt plan, first pmt due 30 days after release from jail. 15CF224 called @ 2:29 p.m. same appearances. Def has received copy of complaint, reading waived, time limits for ph waived. Court reviews prelim rights. State moves to amend bond to $5000 signature with same conditions. Court finds waiver freely made.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
